content.description:
Very unique and entertaining movement on an overhanging arete. If you enjoy pinches, heel hooks, compression, and flexing biceps, this climb hits the nail on the head. 

  Start sitting, hugging the arete with a good right hand pinch and a pretty poor left hand pinch on the face. Make a lefthand move up to a slopey hueco and work into the opposing sidepull crimps. Clever technique should lead you to the marquee move maneuvering through the large, made to order, sledgehammer pinch. From here, span out left to a deep jug, and exit onto the slab.
Start sitting sitting on a right facing hold. Trend slightly right aiming for great jugs that set you up for a good top out
content.location: At the end of the corridor above The Maiden. On the right side of the wall. To the left is a V3 called The Scoop

content.description:
Amazing rock and features combined with a low crux make this a must do highball. In many areas this would be a 3-5 bolt sport climb. 

  Move up the short wall to the roof and reach over. use a heal to turn the lip, this in itself is getting to be kind of high. Now cruise up the 25 foot tall gorgeous wall of big huecos.
content.protection: Pad and spotter for the bottom and a camera for the victory romp to the top.
content.location: This is the obvious tall wall that stands guard over the lower end of the Maiden Gully, you can see the problem from the Dark Heart, Dragons Den and just about anywhere in Comanche Canyon. Starts in a flat spot near a tree.

content.description: Start on a Jug and go straight up to spicy topout.
content.location: On the right side of Lucky Rock.

climbs.name: Lifestyles of the Steep and Heinous

content.description: A nice V8 version of a "step-off" Hueco roof climb (eg Baby Martini, Flower Power, etc).
Start on jug rail around the corner from Creamy. Traverse right into same top out.
content.location: next to creamy, start is around the corner

content.description: Traverse the horizontal crack up and left starting on crimp rail.
content.location: In a corridor to the right of The Maiden.

content.description:
Great diversity on a boulder problem. Great problem but can be painful, tape might help for the start. 

  Start out with a steep hands to cups crack. Then motor across the horizontal roof with some long reaches on pretty good holds. Finally fight through the bulge at the top on positive crimps. 

  Each section might be about V4 but by the time you get to the end you are spent.
content.location: Hard to describe the location in words, but essentially right in the middle of the climbing and on the underside of a boulder. You can't miss the starting crack when you see it.

content.description:
This is a boulder choked gully high on East Mountain above and right of the end of Comanche Canyon. The area has a goof bit of diversity, from easy to about V8 and short to quite tall. Most problems in this area are going to be well shaded and sheltered from the wind. 

  Classics include the highball, The Maiden and the head height roof with a little of everything, Beer Pizza and a Three Foot Toothless Girl.
